newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian rocket crashes after launch - Tass.
newsitem.headline: Russian rocket crashes after launch - Tass.

text.p: A Russian rocket carrying a military satellite crashed on Tuesday when its engine failed immediately after launch from the Baikonur cosmodrome in Kazakhstan, Itar-Tass news agency said.
No one was injured when the Zenit-2 crashed in the steppe several km (miles) from Baikonur. Tass said the engine had failed 48 seconds into the flight.
Tass said there had been 27 launches of Zenit-2 booster rockets since 1985, including two launches of military satellites earlier this month. All the others had been successful.
The agency said a top-level commission was investigating the reason for the engine's failure.
Russia leases Baikonur, the former main cosmodrome of the Soviet Union, from Kazakhstan.
